alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a fatty acid moiety linked to an amine group through an ester linkage.
alternative_parents.name: N-acyl amines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an amide derivative of carboxylic acid, with the general structure RN(R1)C(R2)=O (R1-R2 any atom but H).
alternative_parents.name: Tertiary carboxylic acid amides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonyl group, with the general structure RS(=O)2R' ( R,R' must not be H).
alternative_parents.name: Sulfonyls

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing the sulfonic acid group, which has the general structure RS(=O)2OH (R is not a hydrogen atom).
alternative_parents.name: Organosulfonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic acids containing an alkane chain linked to a sulfonic acid group. They have the general structure RS(=O)2-OH (R = alkyl).
alternative_parents.name: Alkanesulfonic acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing metals and halogens. Some are ionic while others are covalently bonded.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metal halides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organonitrogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a fluorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organofluorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a sodium ion.
alternative_parents.name: Organic sodium salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a carbonyl group, with the general structure RC(=O)R', where R=organyl, R'=H, N, O, organyl group or halide group.
alternative_parents.name: Carbonyl compounds

class.description: Organic compounds containing a linear aliphatic chain (or ring system) carrying a C-X bond, where X is a halogen atom.
class.name: Alkyl halides

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as perfluoroalkyl carboxylic acid and derivatives. These are organic compounds containing an alkyl chain attached to the C-alpha of a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), where all hydrogens of the alkyl chain are replaced by fluorine atoms.

direct_parent.description: Organic compounds containing an alkyl chain attached to the C-alpha of a carboxylic acid group (or a derivative thereof), where all hydrogens of the alkyl chain are replaced by fluorine atoms.
direct_parent.name: Perfluoroalkyl carboxylic acid and derivatives

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl fluoride functional group with formula R-F , where R is an alkyl group.
subclass.name: Alkyl fluorides

superclass.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and a halogen atom (At, F, Cl, Br, I).
superclass.name: Organohalogen compounds
